customer_addr:
1801 East Chestnut Avenue
Santa Ana, CA 92701

citations.narrative:
On 1/21/2025, a nearly 15-year-old male Sun Conure, #B11022, was found missing when he failed to arrive for his
morning feeding. He had been observed earlier the same morning for the daily observation count of this large walk-in
aviary containing twelve birds. This incident was self-reported on 1/24/2025 when #B11022 was officially recorded as
missing and is still missing.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals
and the public.
Correct by 2-26-2025 and forward.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
At approximately 11:30 am during the inspection of the walk-through aviary, a rat was observed running on the floor of the
bird feeding area next to the entrance/exit area of the enclosure. Rats can carry diseases or possibly harm birds in the
enclosure.
Pest control. A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests must
be established and maintained so as to promote the health and well-being of the birds and reduce contamination by pests
in animal areas. Insecticides, chemical agents, or other pest control products that may be harmful to the birds must not be
applied to primary enclosures and other bird contact surfaces unless the application is consistent with manufacturer
recommendations or otherwise approved for use and does not harm birds.
Correct by March 31, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KATHLEEN GARLAND, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On 1/21/2025, a nearly 15-year-old male Sun Conure, #B11022, was found missing when he failed to arrive for his 
morning feeding. He had been observed earlier the same morning for the daily observation count of this large walk-in 
aviary containing twelve birds. This incident was self-reported on 1/24/2025 when #B11022 was officially recorded as 
missing and is still missing. 
 
 During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with 
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals 
and the public. 
 
Correct by 2-26-2025 and forward. 
3.158(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
At approximately 11:30 am during the inspection of the walk-through aviary, a rat was observed running on the floor of the 
bird feeding area next to the entrance/exit area of the enclosure. Rats can carry diseases or possibly harm birds in the 
enclosure. 
 
Pest control. A safe and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests must 
be established and maintained so as to promote the health and well-being of the birds and reduce contamination by pests 
in animal areas. Insecticides, chemical agents, or other pest control products that may be harmful to the birds must not be 
applied to primary enclosures and other bird contact surfaces unless the application is consistent with manufacturer 
recommendations or otherwise approved for use and does not harm birds.  
 
Correct by March 31, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

Additional Inspectors: 
KATHLEEN GARLAND, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
